text: Dark brown/black color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, rich milk chocolate, vanilla, & coffee; Flavor of roasted malt, coffee, bittersweet chocolate, molasses, and some licorice; Smooth finish; Very nicely balanced; A tad thin but great stuff - underrated.

Bottles. BBE Dec 2013; Drank Jan 2008 AND BBE Jun 2016; Drank Apr 2016 - Very Dark Brown in colour. Small creamy beige head. Spare lacing. Very Malty; roasty/burnt malts, dark chocolate, creamy coffee, liquorice, caramel, some smoke. Hoppy; some hop bitterness. Good malt/hop balance. Silky smooth. Moderately bitter roast/burnt chocolate and coffee malty throughout. Bitter dry roast malty and salty finish. Liked this. Excellent Foreign Stout! (2016-04-07)

Data ważności:  25.11.2022 
 Kolor:  Ciemno brązowy, klarowny z rubinowymi refleksami. 
 Piana:  Kremowa, zbita, tworząca jedną warstwę.
Szybko kurczy się i zatrzymuje na poziomie 1 krótkiego krążka. Przy przechylaniu szkła widać trochę malunków na ściankach. 
 Zapach:  W aromacie czuć prażony jęczmień, gęstą czekoladę i ziarna kawy.
Nuty prażone przeplatają się z nutami palonymi.
Na zapleczu odrobina karmeli i cukru trzcinowego. 
 Smak:  W smaku mocno palone, wręcz popiołowe. Sporo ciemnych słodów i kwaskowatej kawy z mocnym finiszem.
Czekolady jest tylko minimum, odrobina ciemnych owoców i szczypta lukrecji.
Goryczka długa, ściągająca, drażniąca język.
Finisz kwaskowaty, popiołowy z popielniczkowym posmakiem w ustach.
Bardzo wodniste ciało, które kompletnie nie pasuje do styl.
Wypić wypiłem, ale wielkiego szału tutaj nie nie było. 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Imperial Stout ze szwedzkiego Browaru Nils Oscar to tak na prawdę FES.
Kiedyś piwo było wybierane najlepszym piwem na świecie w swoim stylu podczas World Beer Cup.
Dzisiaj jest cieniem swojego pierwowzoru.
Największa porażka jest okropnie wodnista tekstura, która w niczym nie przypomina topowych FES-ów.
Piwo do wypicia, ale także do szybkiego zapomnienia...
Sample at Stockholm Beer and Whiskey festival. nice stout but weak 7% to be an imperial one.

Pours clear, very dark brown. Ok white head. Smell is Rich, rather bitter dark malts. Taste is full, creamy, mild coffee, roasted malts. Bit lactic even. Ok. Bit roasty in the aftertaste, mild sweetness

Originally sampled on 11/28/08. I was pretty impressed by this one, The aroma was really nice, strong sweet chocolate with coffee undertones. Initial flavor of chocolate with some nuttiness showing and a nice coffee aftertaste. Mouthfeel was smooth and it is a well balanced beer with all flavors sharing the stage. Overall it is a pretty nice Imp. stout and i wouldnt mind having more someday.

Pours a very deep brown body with a tiny, frothy, tan and very short-lived head. Malty, sweet and strong aroma of milk chocolate, chocolate sauce, dark caramel and dark roasted malt, with hints of tobacco in the back. Strong flavour of chocolate, dark caramel, dark roasted malt, and leather and brown sugar in the back. Moderate sweet taste with a moderate to heavy bitter finish. Mid-bodied, smooth texture and close to no carbonation. A good one, but it could have needed some more carbonation. 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 4.5 years before BB date, from Systembolaget Kungshamn, Sweden]

Bottle. Euro Summer Secret Santa Swap. Very dark brown - black. Vanilla, a little bit of wood, and lots of chocolate. Bitter, woodsy, dry and yet chocolatey taste. Full body, a little bit of fizz, complex. BlackBerry and vanilla finish.

The aroma is malt, a little coffee, a little chocolate and roasty. Pours black fully diminishing tan head. The taste is bitter. The body is medium, the texture creamy, the carbonation lively and the finish bitter. Very Good for a 7% that is probably close to nine years old.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Dark brown pour with khaki head. Chocolatey aroma with hints of roast, dark fruits and sweet liquorice. The taste is quite thin with light roast, chocolate and caramel. Not matured at all this might be lacking something. This falls somewhat in between. Balanced and clean, but a little bit thin and a little too sweet.

Flaska. Mörkt brun, närmast svart, med ett litet beigt skum. Dofter av kaffe, rostad malt och lakrits. Smakinslag av kaffe, choklad, lakrits, rostad malt och en lättare rökighet. Medelstor kropp. Kaffe i eftersmaken. Trevlig stout.

Fat från 2007. Svart med brunt skum. Doftar mörk choklad och mörk frukt. Mjuk och fyllig smak med mörk choklad, kaffe, fruktig sötma, aningen rökighet och en fin efterbeska. Suveränt komplex och balanserad. De Klomp 2015-12-19
330ml bottle. Black body with almost no crown. Roasted malt, some burnt notes, fruit. Finishes dry and bitter.
Flaska från SB, ölprovning Nils Oscar vs. Eskilstuna, Nerikes Ölsällskap. Sötsur och något rökig doft. Ganska snäll. Lagom tunn kropp. Lite choklad i smaken, lite rök och aska. Jämn.

Totally dark with an average size, mocha colored head that faded fast and left spotty lacing. Aroma of molasses, chicory and dried fruit. Taste is burnt toast, dark fruit and roasted coffee. Notes of bittersweet chocolate in the aftertaste. ABV not too high for the style. Full bodied, modestly carbonated mouthfeel with a long lasting finish.

It has light brown foam and smells most of licorice and a slight hint of coffee and caramel. The taste has good licorice but is most dominated by bitter coffee and here are my taste buds not so happy anymore.

330ml bottle. Almost black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, licorice, coffee, caramel, bready, some fruity notes. Sweet and bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Black with no head worth mentioning. Charcoal, wine gums and chocolate. Sudden charcoal followed by a more complex palette of malt, licorice and grapes. Surprisingly light body for an imperial stout.

a lot going on in this one - perhaps too much when taken with the odd amount of heat for a weaker abv impy. Strong flavors and aroma...some char and roast, raisins and hints of smoke. light coffee/chocolate. A slight metallic edge that knocks a couple points off.

Bottle, BBE 2020/02. Deep brown color, light brown head. Licorice nose, roasted malt, milk chocolate, vanilla. Milk chocolate taste, roasted malt, moderate sweetness, light coffee bitterness, metallic note. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, oily texture.

330 ml bottle. Black with a tan head. The aroma of soy sauce and burnt malts. The flavor starts sweet and plenty of dried dark fruit, candies and and milk chocolate. Then gets a little rough of wood chips and smoke. The aftertaste is dry and bitter, a bit like eating a box of chalks. Unfortunately, the thin body makes it bit watery. Id like to have a more compact feeling that we normally find in an imperial stout.

Aroma is standard stout sensations, nothing really pops out but there is roasted malts, coffee and a smaller note of chocolate. The taste is solid and robust stout, very well contained and in the area where it is supposed to be. It is diplomatic and well mannered, almost excusing itself for invading your privacy. But... it fades away really quick, and I dont get that much of after taste. And I guess heres where the "Foreign Stout" classification sets in, it delivers more than a Porter, but it lacks the muscle and power from a modern Imperial Stout to hang around and keep you company. Still, its Swedish, robust, very well brewed and perfect as a weekday stout with its slightly lower abv.
Svart med høyt lys brunt skum. Lite lukt, iskaffe og kakaopulver. Lett bitter brent karamell og mørk sjokolade. Lett imperial stout, litt søtlig avslutning.
Pours black with a brownish head that recedes to a bubbly lacing. Aroma is roast malts, raisins and rye bread. Taste is rye bread, roast malts and slightly sweet. Medium bodied and quite oily.

Black. Dark roasty coffee, dry chocolate. Roasty, some salt licorice. Pretty ok. Not overpowering or sweety full. More like a robust porter than impy.-- bb

Aroma: coffee, toasted malts, chocolate, quite intense. Appearance: black, medium creamy beige head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: light sweets continue, chocolate, light bitters coming up, some coffee, average-long finish, 
Overall: excellent Imperial Stout, not too heavy, yet remains nicely balanced and complex. Bottle from Beers of Europe, Kings Lynn.
Bottle at home. Pours black, aroma and taste of chocolate, sweet, chewy, tasty.
Backlog. Dominated coffee and chocolate, some caramel and dried fruits aswell.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Black with thin head. Nice roast on this one, a lot of coffee and some slight chocolate. Taste is upfront a nice bitterness which evens out with the coffee and roastiness, very one trick pony forward, but still, nice, and an excellent stout for 7%.

Sunday Stout Series. 33 cl bottle. Pours dark opaque brown with small head. Coffee, chocolate and some toffee and fruit notes in aroma and taste. Well balanced in bitterness, sweetness and ABV!

330ml bottle from Appellation Wines - Cheers Ash! Pours dark brown, near black, thin tan head that doesnt stick around. Aromas of tar and cola. Taste brings chocolate and light roast. Kinda sweet. Bit disappointed to be honest.

Have to say that this was a disappointment. Was supposed to be part of a nice "one-two punch" but this was more like a foreign stout than an imperial stout. At only 7% and thin mouthfeel. No chocolate and the coffee tasted more like when you use old coffee grains again for a new cup of coffee. Subtle would be a nice word.
I like it. Not pushing any boundaries but its a solid, punchy stout. A good taste of roasted malt with coffee and chocolate. Quite light feel and very smooth - dont notice the alcohol. Well done.

Sort skum brunlig kort 
Kaffe tømmer citrus rørsukker 
Bitter moderate sød moderate 
Cremet blød 
@home

330ml bottle. Dark black pour with thin tanned head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Full mouth feel and velvety smooth. Bitter dry finish.
33cl bottle. Thick black color, light brown head. Aroma has lot of coffee, roasted malt and hints of dark chocolate. Light carbonation and alcohol doesnt taste. Almost belgian-like.
Bottle 2006 at Smöf 2013. Black with thin light brown head. Aroma is dried fruits, chocolate, caramel. Sweet woody taste.
2006 bottled from SMÖF 2013. Pours black with a small brown head. Smells and tastes chocolate, figs and raisins, roasted malt and coffee.

Systembolaget. Drukket i tulip. Fin lidt mildere stout, næsten sort med 1 cm skum som hurtigt falder. God smag med toner af chokolade og kaffe. 
Fin afslutning på en god weekend i Sverige!

Not very nice, might have been something wrong with my bottle. A bit waterey ang quite weak in flavour, but there was a good beer with nice roastal tones underneath. Expected more, but Ill give it another shot.

330 ml bottle. 89473-03. BB Aug/15. (Alko) Helsinki, Finland. 
Black colour with a small tan head. 
Berries and roasted malt in the aroma. 
Malt and mild berries in the flavour. Tasty. Strong and smooth.
Black body, light brown head. Aroma has sweet coffee, molasses, medicinal hops. Flavour has sweet malt, sugars and cough drop.

330 ml bottle 2003 vintage, sampled in 2008. Dark brown body with a small, dense beige head. Nice aroma of roasted malt, coffee and dark chocolate. Flavor is sweet, silk smooth, dark, roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, some warming alcohol, balanced bitterness and a light but pleasant hint of oxidation. Nice body and good aftertaste. A nice beer served under optimal conditions I believe.

Bottle, poured into a tulip. Predictably black with a small off-white head that endures. Smell isnt very strong - some yeast, smoke, compost. Body is medium. Taste - lots of roasted barley, sweet toffee comes through, yeast, smoke, coffee, crayon. Astringent finish. The overall impression isnt great here - toned down and insipid despite the array of flavours.

330ml bottle from The Cave, Glasgow (£3.29):
Dark, roasted malt notes and coffee followed by dark chocolate & fruits with some sweetness coming from them and some sugar. The aroma is verging on that of a foreign export stout.

Black with a tanned brown head that is thumb sized initially before settling as a thin lacing on the top of the beer.

Dark chocolate and dried fruits to begin, along with some coffee along this isnt as strong as I was expecting. There is some sweetness that follows this with some sugar, vanilla and caramel.

Medium and smooth with a great balance between the sweetness and the roasted bitterness. Carbonation is light-medium carbonation that is just about right. The alcohol is well hidden too.

A good stout that falls somewhere in between a traditional English one and a Russian imperial one yet also hints at a foreign export one in places. Despite the fact it seems all over the place geographically and in style in worked very well and struck the right balance between the flavours.

När Nils Oscar ställer till med kalas kan man bespetsa sig på något utöver det vanliga. Förväntningarna kommer inte på skam när Imperial Stout ingår konspiration med blodet och pumpar ut välbefinnande till varje skrymsle i kroppen. Njut medan tid är.
Kolsvart med litet ljusbrunt skum som snabbt försvinner! Kaffe, lakrits och rökmalt i doft och smak! Lite blaskig!
Flaska från Systembolaget. Kaffe, tobak och röda bär. Kraftig smak av mörk öl parad med kraftig alkoholkänsla.

Kolejne swietne piwo od Nilsa Oscara. Bogactwo smakow. Od czekolady do gozkiej i mocnej kawy, palony slod dominuje i wlasnie ta kawa ktora jakby towazyszy przez caly czas degustacji. Czarna ciecz kremowa i zoltawa piana. Ten Imperialny stout jest bardzo palony. Alkohol na poczatku sie pojawia ale kawa go przytlacza i finisz jest bardzo wyraznie palony co za tym idzie wytrawny. Imperial Stout jak sie patrzy.
Coffee, dark chocolate, liqourice, and red berries aroma. Taste of burnt toast and coffee. Mostly sour aftertaste. A quite fruity Imperial stout.
Opaque black with tan head. Roasty, dark chocolate, coffee, dark fruits, slight sourness. Dry, a bit sticky.

Black beer with little brown head. Aromas of roasted malts, sweet chocolate and coffee. Flavors of dark bread, roadted malts, sweet chocolate and bitterness. Thick and soft mouthfeel with a nice finish.
Bottled. Nice juicy malt, wood / barrel aroma (?), chocolate. Dry and tasty, dark chocolate, wood, some coffee. Rich, austere, dry, a touch of soy. Nice old world stuff.

Appearance: Jet black with a thin short lived tan head.
Aroma: Bitter chocolate, hint of fudge and liqourice, with a slight coffee note.
Taste:  A medium sweetness and bitterness, with a lingering roasty/malty aftertaste.
Palate: Smooth texture, light body and soft carbonation.
Comments: Enjoyable beer that I would have again. Drank from a Snifter glass. Glass lace.

330ml bottle, pours black with a small foamy tan head, the aroma is chocolate, hints of coffee and vanilla, slightly milk texture. Palate is good, a little thin. Really good stout, nicey balanced flavours and very quaffable.

17/04 A 0.33 l bottle, courtesy of ogivlado, great thanks for another share! It poured typical pitch black body with tiny brown head. Salty, woody, humid coffee aroma. Flavor was slightly sweet like caramel, dried plums, raisins and roasted sugar, but even more, coffee dominated with according bitterness and acidity. Very tasty, but quite empty for the style, although cant be fuller at only 7% ABV - medium bodied with long, sweetish cocoa and coffee finish. A tasty stout, well done.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with a tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, cocoa, and a little coffee. Flavour is roasted malt and hints of chocolate and coffee.

Bottle from BeerHive, Edinburgh [170513]
Black, thin tan head, little lacing
Aroma of dark meaty malts, dark chocolate, dab of soy, very soft deep roast, quite savoury, complex nose
Taste as aroma, getting a lot of soy, dark savoury malts, very soft roast, dab umami, good flavour
Palate - soft carb, thin to medium body, surprising thin for an imperial stout, quite smooth and soft oily. Finish as main flavour, smooth dark malts
Overall - It would benefit from having a bit more body. Has a nice dark malt, quite meaty savoury flavour

Black in color with a tan head. Roasted malt, dark fruits, earthy hops, and coffee. Hints of dark chocolate, some sherry, and a hint of smoke. The flavor is not as good as the nose. A bit ashy, lots of roast, coffee, and some smoke. Sherry, metal, and dark chocolate. A touch on the bitter side.

Bottled 330ml. -from trade with Nisse666, thanks Thomas. Black coloured, small brownish head, mild notes of wood in the nose. Roasted malt, roasted coffee and chocolate with mild notes of wood and smoke. Dry finish. Nice brew.

Bottle.  Could not find a date on the bottle.  Pours pitch black with almost no head.  Nice roasty aroma mixed with chocolate, soy sauce, and very light smoke.  Taste is a little sweet at first but some bitterness and roast comes quickly to balance it.  Lots of soy sauce taste but in a good way.  Chocolate and vanilla come through nicely in the finish.  Mouthfeel in a little thin but its silky smooth.  Overall, very easy to drink with some nice rich flavors.  Good stuff.
[@ Öl och whiskymässan, Malmö] Svart svart. Kaffe och kakao. Väldigt välbalanserad smak. En viss beska och syrlighet på slutet. Fin imp

Oooh, I though Id had this one before. Obviously not. The expectations were high, and damn did this meet them. Nisse & Ogis. Poured a very very dark brown body tinged with amber on top of which perched a small off white head. Hmm... wine barrel (is this aged?) and roastiness in the aroma, slightly sourish, very light soy sauce. The taste is fully malty, again seemingly vinuous, damn pleasant.... light... something that my pen refused to write on the paper so I mustve been wrong about it. Not one of my brightest ratings but this was definitely a nice one.

Clearing backlog. No comments. Apologies, future ratings will have detail.

Kaatuu tulppaaniin sysimustana ja todella niukkavaahtoisena. Vaahto myös jättää vahvan reunuksen ja hieman pitsiä. Haju on todella, todella tuhdin paahteinen, myös paahtunutta ruisleipää. Taustalta kuitenkin nousee noeasti paahteen rinnalle lakritsia, yrttiä, juurta ja hiven suklaatakin. Vahvoja hajuja. Maku on huomattavan lakritsinen. Mukana on toki paahdetta, muttei niin paljon. Yrttiä ja kahvia on selvästi mukana, lopussa iskee taas kermaisuus ja jää suuhun. Suutuntuma on melko täyteläinen ja lopun kermaisuus jää vahvana suuhun. Positiivinen yllätys, vaikka olen aiemmin todennut hyväksi. Hajussa tykittää ensin vahva paahde, mutta lakritsi nopeasti tasaa sen. Maussa taas tasapainoisuus jyllää, jättäen mukavan kermaisen suutuntuman.

Bottle from Cunningham, many thanks. Dark chestnut brown color with thick beige had. Very impressive aroma of roasted malt, molasses, coffee, dark chocolate,ash. Malty taste with coffee, dark chocolate, licorice, hints of dark berries, wood. Dry, roasty bitter finish. Delicious. I would have more for aging.
This review is exported from olutopas.info with no comment. Original rating date  5.1.2011

AROMA: barnyard, bread, hay, nuts, roasty, hint of smoke
APPEARANCE: black, frothy, minimal head, brown foam, 
TASTE: light sweetness, medium bitterness, 
PALATE: thin feel, soft carbonation, long finish, 
OVERALL: gentle stout with pleasant aromas that blend well, palate a bit too thin.
Black, chocolate, a little young, will be better over time, good beer with a complex and well balanced profile..

330mL from blomster at RBWG. Thanks! Pours clear, deep brown to black. No sediment. Medium mocha head is coaxed out of the bottle, but retention and poor. Nose is a little soy, salty, savory moving to salted real butter on fresh Danish rugbrød (rye bread) and fresh lemon squeeze. Taste is very thin for style, lots of lemon tea and ash. More dirt and mild metallic notes pile on. Mouthfeel is watery ashy, lots of lemon tea. Doesnt have the body for style. Finishes soapy. Too bad.

Noir total, ressemble à du cola lorsque penchée. Un col de mousse brun entoure le breuvage. Semble mi-épaisse. Chocolatée, comme il se doit, avec notes de café et de chêne en finale. Elle est onctueuse et agressive en bouche. Ronde, et tout juste pétillante. Lalcool est absent, seul subsiste le bois et le café. Pas damertume et pas de sécheresse. Verdict : Savoureuse Imperial Stout dans les règles de lart, costaude mais indulgente, directe mais complexe. Sans doute un des fleurons brassicoles suédois.

Bottle, bottled Dec 2010. Black liquid with a small mocha head. Aroma is rich coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts, milk chocolate, classic stout components. Taste: medium bitterness with notes of bitter chocolate and coffee. Slightly sour with a tart cherry note and sour roast. Roasty, rich and well crafted! Good one!

Could this be the best Imperial Stout I drinking? Maybe so. The scent is not as heavy as I thought it would be. The taste, however, is heavenly. Yeah, I need to say more? The aftertaste is never ending. Its like an Imperial Stout should taste. Perfect beer I think.

33 cl bottle @ home. Rated on 02.10.2009
Aroma has coffee, roasted malt, licorice and hints of dark chocolate. Flavour has somewhat salty licorice, coffee notes, some soy sauce and hints of herbs. Definitely a foreign stout  too thin to be imperial.

Appearance: Black color with a beige head. Nice lacing.Aroma: Slightly sweet chocolate and coffee.Palate: Light medium body. Slightly sweet and a low bitterness. Creamy carbonation.Taste: Rick chocolate and mild roasted malt. Cold coffee. Well hidden alcohol.Overall impression: A bit rare this one. Very tasty and nice, although an unusual thin texture.Personal stats: Bottle  from Systembolaget in Strömstad, Sweden.

Mycket mörk brun öl med brunt skum som snabbt försvinner. Doft: Kaffe, kakao, (mycket) gräddkola, rostat trä. Smak: Grape, kaffe, honungsmelon, gräddkola, rostat trä. Inget fel på smaken men doften... omg, underbar.

Im drinking dark stuff tonight ready for Ripper Street. Did the Swedes get to have a Victorian era? King Oscar of Sweden had tattoos, as did Tsar Nicholas II. Im sure he liked an Imperial Stout. This really is very good, quite light but lip smackingly tasty.

Bottle at konttori, tampere. Aroma of coffee, licorice, chocolate, cognac and some alcohol, quite nice. Taste is little disappointment, at most medium body, almost watery, coffee and roasted malts, some syrup.
Bottle. Black colour with a large beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate. Bitter flavour of roasted malt, coffee, dark fruit.

Heavy 11.2 oz bottle served in a pint glass. A somewhat aggressive pour produced only about 1 finger of surprisingly durable head. A nice hint of red-orange color in the tan head. Very dark and opaque black-brown.  
Exceptional aroma with a more pronounced chocolate component than found even in chocolate stouts. No hop presence.  Richly flavored with plenty of chocolate and toasted malt. Hops indirectly evident in the limited sweetness. Finish is mainly toasted malt and chocolate, with just a little hint of coffee-like flavors.  Very smooth with full body; might prefer this with a little more carbonation. 

O - excellent product. Not bold or extreme but refined and carefully crafted.

11.2oz bottle - pours black with two fingers of beige head and spotty lacing. Nose is dark fruit, alcohol, chocolate and roast. Flavor adds oak and vanilla. Sweet with light bitterness on the backend. Full body with long and bitter finish. Soft carbonation. Robust but the repeat value diminishes quickly.
Very dark colour. Intense toasted aroma. The flavour is very good, toasted and coffee notes. Very good one.
Draught at ÖÖWF 2012. Aroma roasted, sweet and full bodied. Tastes bland, coffe and some bitterness in the aftertaste. Watery.
Dark brown, almost black. Small head. Chocolate, tar and vanilla in pleasant combination. Stored in the cellar for some years - probably good for it.

Flaske på Café Viking, København: en herlig kraftkar av en stout, med alle de rette smakselementene. En anelse salt i ettersmaken - har de brukt litt røykmalt? Uansett,, en kjempegod stout jeg gjerne tar igjen.
UPDATED: NOV 7, 2012 Underbar arom av choklad och rödvin!. Nästan svart, mörk gul bregränsad skumkrona. Smaken då; Njaaa, jag är ju ingen älskare av porter/stout men den är nog ganska god ?

Pours nearly black, red edged...almost no head, just a few very dark brown islands of spinning foam.
Scent is sweetly chocolate and wine.
Taste is heavy roast chocolate with a slightly ashy bitter.
Very tasty..

Poured into a perfect pint.

3.0 A: Black color. Half a finger of frothy tan head. Retention is poor and just a tiny ring of lacing is left.

4.5 S: Like the coffee stout, this is wildly earthy. Mineral, mountain stream water, clay, general woodziness. Supple roast, subtle coffee, plenty of dark chocolate, a touch of caramel. Fairly dry, but not too dry. Really nice nose on this.

4.0 T: Pretty much like the nose, but it doesnt impress me as much. The flavors are less bold than the nose suggest. Still, its quite tasty. Mineral, mountain water, outdoors. Moderate roast, subtle coffee and chocolate, and a touch of caramel. Again mainly dry with just a touch of balancing sweetness.

3.5 M: Medium body. A little undercarbonated, not as much as the coffee stout though. Light creaminess and super smooth.

4.0 D: Very tasty, earthy beer. I might get a couple more of these. Solid all around.

text: 33cl bottle. Pours opaque black to chestnut brown with some red glints. The nose has dark chocolate, then tobacco, heading into liquorice possibly heading into charcoal and with a creaminess in the nose texture. The taste has dates, almost but not quite heading into prunes in alcohol then nougat and bitter chocolate. The palate is big in structure with a loverly cream texture and a fairly elegant finish. Overall, a really well made beer.

Bottle at home in London. Aged a good few months, at least. Pours clear, auburn-brown with a fine, beige foam head. Big dark malt nose, some burnt meat, a bit of cocoa, earth. Medium sweet flavor with some sturdy roast, ash, some beef jerky, burnt grass and earth, some tobacco. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Dry, roasty finish with some baking cocoa, lightly salty meat, burnt earth bitterness, very subtle lactic tang, cigarette ash, a bit of milk chocolate and hints of raisins. Pretty nicely nuanced stuff. Not too heavy - in a good way.

Foreign stout. Foreign to who? Cant be foreign to everyone. Even a Frenchman isnt a foreigner in his own country. There have been periods in my life where Ive felt like a foreigner even when at home. By no means easy times, but definitely interesting times to reflect upon. Big roast, coffee, not loads else going on.

Black with a thin mocha coloured head. Roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, smoke and tar on the nose. Coffee and roasted malt notes dominate the slightly sweet taste and linger in the short, bitter finish. Relatively thin mouthfeel.

This one has been cellared for a while - pour was very thin for an imperial stout...some clear red hues on the edges and otherwise black.  Aroma of roasted malts, some chocolate, some burnt malts as well.  Flavor is fairly good - some acidic undertones that werent particularly pleasant, but lots of roasted malt notes, some residual sweetness.  Palate is decent, but below-average for the style, as it was a bit thinner than Id like.  Overall, this isnt a bad offering - quite easy drinking for the style, but I agree with the RB foreign stout nomenclature versus the imperial stout as it doesnt live up to the latter.
Bit of a let down for me, moth feel was too light and waterey, flavour was weak although roasty and coffee was there, this was just not enough for an imperial stout

Aroma: Burned tones, dark coffee.Appearance: Very dark brown/black, a tan head that settles quickly leaving little lacing and some curtains.Taste: Starting with dark bread, burned crust, sweet dark dried fruits, some bitter coffee and dark chocolate.Palate: Medium low carbonation, soft, slightly sticky, a small bitterness.Overall: A decent imperial stout, lacks some sturdiness though.Note: Bottle 330 ml, thx FS.. Reviewed 2012-09-22.

Tydligen tappad 2010. Väldigt mörkt brun, lätt röd ton. Skummet är litet och beige och lämnar kvar små spår längs glaset.  Luktar lätt rostad malt, kaffe och lite choklad. Maltig, söt smak utan större beska. För tunn kropp.

New Beer Distributors, NY 330ml ($6.05): Pours black with small brown head. Aroma is molasses, with some dark chocolate, and roasted malts. Taste is slightly sweet. Roasted malts are lightly present throughout. Pretty easy drinking. Not exceedingly complex, but well-balanced.

(Bottle). Sweet and vaguely sour aroma of roasted, slightly smoky burnt malt, brown sugar and sticky alcohol. Soft taste of especially salty licorice but also roasted malt, coffee and dark chocolate. The aftertaste is a little dry with hints of bitter coffee.
33cl, Swedish brew, from The Bottle Shop Canterbury, complex Stout, malty/roasted and slightly sweet/smoked, balanced, clear, small head, good brew

Dark, very dark ruby with brownish foam head, lacing to glass. Aroma is dark malts, chocolate, coffeebeans, raisins and slightly sweet. Taste is roasted raisin, coffee, bitter chocolate. Very soft in mouth. Bitter aftertaste. (Göteborg 201208)

Drank straight from a bottle. No idea of the bottling date, but the best before is four years away, so I reckon it could be laid down for a while.

First struck by the minimal head and the lack of aroma. Not much going on there.

Quite a thin texture compared to porter, but much more depth than your average Guinness. Soft carbonation. Long, slightly bitter finish. Theres a depth of flavour there, but it hasnt developed its potential.

Might need some more time to mature.

33cl bottle from trade with SaintMatty, shared with Dutchdrebus. Almost black colored, but when held into the light a deep dark red glow comes through. Medium sized very light brown head that fairly quickly becomes a slight lacing on top. Smell dark malts, chocolate, coffeebeans, raisins and slightly sweet. Taste dark malts, lightly some roastyness, lightly raisin, some coffee and chocolate hints, slightly dark fruits and bastogne-koeken. Soft, velvety mouthfeel, soft carbonation, low to medium body.

Bottle thx to benzai. Black with some ruby redness shining through with a decent, creamy slightly off-white head. Smells dog food (salty somehow), dark chocolate, roasty, coffee, malts, burned. Tastes roasty, coffee, dark chocolate, some mocca, roasty, burned. Quite a nice and long lasting taste. Very soft on the throat, silky, medium to full body. Really enjoyable beer.

Bottle. Dark Brown/Black with a tan head. Aroma of chocolate malt and fruit. Flavour has a heady balance of Coffee, chocolate and cake dough. Full bodied and delicious. I can imagine this would taste edgier after a couple of years of aging.

11.2 oz. bottle, pours a very dark brown / near-black with a small tan head. Aroma of toasted notes, slight fruitiness and earthy dank notes. Flavour of weak toasted nuts, some stale coffee, soy sauce and bittersweet chocolate. Very thin and watery, weak flavoured and tastes like day-old coffee. This is a bit of a failure.

Bottle. Dark brown/black. Thin, caramel colored head. Nose: Roasted malts, espresso, dark berries, blackcurrant. Taste is much the same, with the initial roasted malts and then fruity sweetness and coffee bitterness. Medium-thin mouthfeel.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2013 Bottle from Systembolaget, 2010 vintage.
Pours black with a 1 finger brown head that retains for quite some time.
Aroma is malty with a lot of chocolate and raisins as well as hazelnut/nutella. 
The taste is complex; Sweet, roasted, coffee, liquorice, raisins and a lot of bitter chocolate.
Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied.
Finishes off with a chocolatey-salty bitterness.

Bottle. Pours deep black with an extremely thin brown head and some lacing. Aroma is wonderfully rich chocolate, espresso, raisin, with a smoky note. Flavor is quite sweet coffee and chocolate with molasses notes and a smoky finish. Rich and full bodied, silky smooth.
En riktigt bra stout. Smak och doft av choklad, torkad frukt. Torr och harmonisk.

Pours dark with low light brown head
Aromas of vailla, scotch malts, bread, hints of dark fruits
Palate is low creamy, medium sweetness, low bitterness, somewhat sticky, watery.
Taste of blueberries, chocolate, some coffee.
Ok stout

Bottle, Beer Ritz, Leeds. Black pour with a fading pillowy tan/off white head. Decent nose of roasted malt, dark choc and cocoa. Pretty lively carbonation. Flavour had some earthy hop, coffee and roasted malts notes. Lacking a bit of body for me really.

Bottle. Pours as good as black with creamy tan head. Lovely aroma of dark chocolate, coffee and little bit bit spicy or boozy perhaps, like a spiced cake mix, cookie dough. Taste is very smooth, chocolate, coffee and burnt toast with a little ovaltine. Rich and creamy. Very delicious

wonderfully complex and deep.
very deep brown. rich coffee flavour with roasted malts. some dried red fruit too.
very very smooth texture.  

bottle, beerritz. leeds

Slät, mörk och kraftfull så ska en öl vara och den här ölen fyller två av tre kriterier. Slät och underbart balanserad, mörkare än mörk men dessvärre är den inte så kraftfull som jag hade önskat. Men det här är en riktigt bra öl ändå, smaken präglas av choklad, lite kaffe och en fruktighet. Slutsats: en riktigt bra öl.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2012 (Bottled) Now this stuff is suave and classy .  As this is a light Imperial Stout being 7% this  has a really full body and excellent captivating  mouth-feel, there is   finesse here ;  roasty nose with smoked notes ,burnt toast , raisins , booze and hops.  Very roasted and rich , bitter chocolate , dark fruit ,mild hops in there ... fucking pleasant.

11.2oz bottle thanks to tkrjukoff.  Cheers, Timo!  Pours a stout brown with a tan head.  Nose is roast, licorice, spices, earth, and some coffee and hop bitterness.  Flavor is similar- licorice, spices, earthy hops, coffee bitterness, and roasted malts.  Light to medium in body for the style and earthy overall.

Pours a thin dark brown, no head at all. Aroma of smoky malts smooth and very tasty. Easy to drink, glad I got to try this. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours black with a khaki/brown head. Good lacing. Sweet, creamy aroma with notes of vanilla and coffee and a touch of alcohol; very reminiscient of Baileys  nice! Roasted notes as it warms. Flavour is roasted, a bit watery, and with a barbecue note. Tart, roasted finish with notes of coffee. Lingering creamy note at first, but as it warms the roasted note claims this as well. Overall pretty good, but the flavour didnt match the aroma. 07.04.12.

Old rating: 8 / 4 / 8 / 4 / 15.
Bottle. Vintage 2001. Pours dark brown with a brownish head. Aroma is sweetish with slight notes of toffee and notes of port starting to build up, no doubt thanks to the age. Flavour is sweetish with a strong smoked note, bordering barbecue. Nice, but could do with a bit more body. I have yet to try a fresh one, though. 28-01-06.

Pours black coffee with a tan head and light persistent lacing.  Starts big with roasted malt and coffee and chocolate.  Grows as it moves through the mouth, dropping a tingling carbonated buzz on the sides of the tongue.  Taste finishes with bittering that doesnt linger, instead, leaving some sweet malt to dissolve neatly.  A complex brew that is very satisfying, surprising for such a low abv.  Recommended.
Kaffe, soja och smulpaj doftas. Mycket god. Kunde kanske varit lite fylligare men rondören är riktig bra. Allt som allt: lite försiktig men brygden är finfin.

2001 version, 33cl bottle courtesy of gnoff!

Very dark brown, thin dark tan head. Scent of chocolate, burnt caramel, and coffee.  Sweet molasses, raisins, mocha coffee dominate the flavor.  Extremely smooth and wonderful mouthfeel.

12 mar 2012, bottle. Dark chocolate brown. Nose is rich malty ovaltine. Med body and faintly fizzy. Meaty and milk chocolate. Big, rich, and intense. Wow. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Monks Porter House. Indicated as 2005 version? Dark brown to black coloured beer with a small white head. Strong alcoholic roasted malty and spicy oaky hinted aroma. Full palate. Finish is bitter sweet fruity and roasted malty with a light alcoholic hint. Very good!

En två år gammal flaska med en fantastik chokladdoft. Smaken lever inte riktigt upp till förväntningarna. Kroppen känns torr och lite platt och de 7% lite i klenaste laget för en IS. Ändå sammantaget en riktigt god extra stout.

33 cl bottle. BBE 09/2015.
Originally rated on 20091009.
Pours pitch black color with medium beige head. Aroma of mild liquorice, peat, some rye notes, hints of coffee and dark roasted malts. Flavor of light liquorice, roasted malts, light coffee and chocolate notes, tar and mild fruits. A bit too watery palate for an imperial stout, but works nicely as an foreign stout. Could use a stronger backbone, nicely balanced otherwise.
5415

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2011 330 ml bottle shipped in from Sweden by Per and many thanks to him as well. Had this on my 48th birthday. Pours a deep black with dark tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, cream and dark dried fruit. Taste is run trough a seris of flavors. Srarts off with a heavy coffe and then cream. Then moves to a roasted malt. It ends slightly bitter. A great beer for sure, but not really my style.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2013 Bottle 07/03/2013 BBE June 2015. Pours a dark brown, nearly black. A latte-colored blanket of a head. Loads of roast in the aroma. Roasted malt bread, roasted crust of malt bread. Some liquorice there as well. Taste is roasted malts, roasted crusty malt bread again. Fairly dry, some nuttiness. Slight flavor of dark fruits in the background. Palate is fairly light and theres not much carbonation.

Bottle 05/11/2011 BBE June 2015. Pours a dark, slightly reddish cola borwn with a small, dark latte head. Aroma is slightly roasted, very malty, some liquorice, tones of coffee. Taste is malty, somewhat roasted, a bit rye breadish. Later turns more chocolatey, more coffeeish. Aftertaste is surprisingly fruity, dried and otherwise. Palate is pleasing, not much carbonation but fairly full.
Pours dark amber with a light brown head. Rich beer with a lot of sweet prunes, raisins and mild chocolate. Light acidity and some smoke in the background.

Bottle 330ml @ home
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

A very complex and balanced Stout. I grabbed this beer off the discount shelf as it was about 8 months old. I found it to be very approachable at 7% with no trace of heat. You could tell the hops had fallen off a bit from fresh but the malts were shining thru nicely and made this a very enjoyable beer.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget and consumed on September 10. Pours black with a thin white head that quickly disappears. Smell is sweet with hints of vanilla and alcohol. Taste is rather sweet with hints of roasted malt, some hops and chocolate. Sadly taste is also a bit watery. Mouthfeel is rather fizzy. A pretty nice and humble stout that is far from living up to being imperial.

Draught at Glenfiddich warehouse, Stockholm.
Pours black with a nice dark brown head.
Nice chocolatey stout with some hops, nice balance.
The taste is not as hoppy as an Imperial stout usual do, but a good stout with a roasted flavor.

33 cl Bottle at Mogwai, Helsingborg. August 2011.

Pitch black with a small brown head. Big and rustic aroma filled with vanilla, milk chocolate, raisins and cacao. Medium to full bodied with a slightly weak taste compared to the aroma. After all its labelled Imperial Stout no matter what rate beers lists it at. The taste is good though with a lot of dark chocolate, coffee and roasted notes from the malt. Small but pleasant bitterness in the finish.

330 ml bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. Pours black with small tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee and dark fruits. Dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malt and notable bitterness in the flavour. Bitter aftertaste.
En väldigt god öl. Mycket choklad och russin. Nästan lite åt portvinshållet, nästan så som den var lagrad. Jaja, ännu en bra öl från Nils Oscar.

Riktigt mörkt brun öl med ett ljusbrunt skum med ganska flycktiga bubblor. Komplex doft med choklad, rostad malt och pumpernickel. Mörk, bitter choklad och mörkrostat kaffe i smaken. En riktigt god öl förutom att bitterheten tog över lite för mycket i eftersmaken. Dock mildrades detta fenomen när jag kom djupare ner i flaskan.
Bottle from Alko Arkadia. Originally rated on 27.4.2009. Quite good imperial stout, but aroma is not that great.

Bottle. 

Black with a small, slighty tan head. A soft stout, with chocolate, some roasted malt, dark fruits and coffee. Good and very drinkable, but I would have preferred the beer a little heavier.
Bottle @ Home. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, dark dried fruit. Taste is coffee, raisins, chocolate, licorice. Full body, low carbonation. Fine stout.

Bottle at Bishops Arms (Stockholm, near Akkurat).  Pours dark brown with medium tan head.  Aroma is chocolate, toffee and licorice.  Flavor is dominated by smooth chocolate with dark fruits in the background and some licorice. (Rated 2011/04/20)

Black with light head
dark fat fruit with a light chockolate
fair body and good length
light sweet taste with licorice and chockolate
nice dry stout
Nose is espresso, chalk, brown sugar, weak alcohol, cereal, feel is quite mellow and wine-like, carb is mediumlow, taste is port, heavy milk, then elegant hops finish

Pours black with dark brown highlights, less viscous than most Imp Stouts. The nose is full of fruity ketones and roasted scents. The first sip is full of toasted and malt flavors yield to fruityness to dark chocolate & slight coffee which linger nicely. Not as big as other Imp Stoutss but still a solide beer.

Bottle @ home. Deep brown appearance with a dark brown head. Burnt, roasty dark chocolate malty, somewhat smoky nose. Creamy, dark chocolatey, lighter bodied, milky, very boozy flavor. I really am not a huge fan. Burnt, boozy aftertaste.

the liquid is very dark, black/dark coffee brown. pours a firm tanned creamy head. looks very intact and stabilized; very good looking. the aroma is extremely rich and complex; coffee, chocolate, wine, malt, vinegar,fruity sweetness, caramel, bread, subtle alcohol, roasty, creamy, slightly herby.. the structure reminds me of Sweet Horizon, thou not so extreme. i was surprised of how gentle this stout was. a very creamy and extremely stable mouthfeel just settles really smoothly creating a nice palate. the aromas were so strong that i was expecting something radical from the taste. the radicalness seemed to be that the taste and palate are so easy and subtle compared to the aromas. sweetness, saltiness, and a nice bitter sidekick. a very rare and extremely well presented concept, good job.

Black pour thin beige head .... aroma of chocolate and roasted coffee, light licorice .... taste of roasted malts, coffee, sweet malts, chocolate. A sweet licorice to it little bit of dark fruit. .... Tasty dry finish nice brew abv hidden well good stout to sit back and enjoy

Poured black with a thin tan head that faded quickly.  Aroma has lots of chocolate malts with roasted notes.  Slightly nutty with some coffee as well.  Not very carbonated.  Lots of roasted flavors with some coffee in the finish.  Aftertaste is a little astringent.  I feel like the lack of carbonation made it not as good for me.  Slightly sweet overall, and tasty.

4/9/11. Bottle shared at Colemans StoutFest thanks to colemanzuber! Black pour with a small brown head. Light roasted aroma with a hint of sour funk. Big roasted flavor with a hint of sour stout in there again. Lingering roasted malt flavor. Not bad!
11.2 oz bottle, sweet aroma, sweet chocolate, brown sugar. Very light for an Imperial. Its alright.

Black/dark brown, brown head. Strong coffee and roasted malt aroma. A bit tart on the palate, dry, not as full bodied as I expected, bitter chocolate. I was expecting this to be more of an imperial stout and was a bit disappointed, and my rating at the time reflects that. Would like to try it again with a different mindset.
Clear mahogny with a light brown rim. Wood, dark fruits, tobacco, cappucino aroma with roasted notes. Medium to full body. Roasted, sweet, bitter and toasted flavors. Dry palate. Medium carbonation.
Bottle, kindly shared by abemorsten. Pours dark with no head. Smells of roasted malts, sugars, coffee. Tastes of bitter chocolate, coffee and roasted malts. Bitter finish.

Pours black with a medium tight well retained head that leaves some lace. The aroma is bitter chocolate, molasses, plenty of dark malt and earthiness. As it warms some vanilla shows up. This is a nicely aromatic beer with an appetizing and luxurious bouquet. The flavor follows with plenty of roasty and earthy malt notes. The beer is pretty bitter all around with notes of cocoa and earthy English hops. There is a mild tart twang in the finish. The beer has a thick and rich mouth feel and it generally seems like a bigger beer than the 7% on the bottle lets on, not in a boozy way at all though. This kind of has all the flavor of a big rich Imperial Stout without a lot of the booze.
Black with a big brown head. Aroma is hard roasted malt, dark chocolate and coffee. Flavor is rather sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and bitter finish. Very nice. 160310

Bottle shared by abemorsten, thanks. Pours black as Coke with a small tanned head. Aroma of dark ripe fruits, coffee and chocolate, lovely. Taste is weaker than suggested by the aroma, ends on the dry side with a lovely dark burnt caramel aftertaste.
This is a very smooth beer. One of the best stouts Ive tasted. Has a very light bitterness with slight chocolate and coffee flavor.
not afan of licorice whci it hqas a strng taste of malty dark chocolate and sum cofee burnt taste
Bottle 33 cl. Poured black colour with beige head. Aroma is coffee, dark chocolate, licorice and malts. Flavour is chocolate, licorice and dark bread. More on the sweet side. Nice burnt aftertaste.

Niinkuin muutkin ovat jo sanoneet on olut lähes musta beigellä vaahdolla. Tuoksussa on soijaa, leipää ja paahtuneita maltaita. Maku jatkuu soijalla, suklaalla ja paahtuneilla maltailla. Hieman kuiva ja maltilisesti hiilihappoinen olut. Hyvä olut, joka on mielestäni enemmänkin stout kuin imperial stout.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2010 Bottle from Alko. Kind of a light version of  Swedish Imperial Stouts like Slottskällans. A bit too much roasted  (or maybe burned even) features (malt and coffee)and lacks the fullness of body compared to the better ones. Still quite good.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2011 Bottle. Black but clear ruby red against the light. Short brown head.
Sweet and a bit creamy on the nose with dark chocolate, slight coffee, some soy and dark fruits.
Taste has a slight sweetness with licorice, coffee, a bit bitter chocolate, dark fruits and soy. Turns quite salty.
Medium bodied with low carbonation and a smooth and a bit sticky mouthfeel.
Salty, a bit burnt but still very smooth and elegant.

*Vintage 2007 on tap @ Akkurat 14/5/11.
Black (seemed clear and ruby red when i held it in the "light") with almost no trace of a head. Aroma: Salty, licorice, soy, a bit smoky, cold coffee.
Taste: Burnt, soy, salty, a bit smoke, coffee and a bit chocolate comes eventually.
Medium body, smooth, low to no carbonation. I had higher expectations on this one. Score:8,3,7,3,14.
Cocoa aroma.  Excellent tan head on a smooth black beer.  Chocolate and coffee on top of nice roasty flavors.  A great stout, would love for them to double it up!

bottle.  Pours very dark brown with red hues, pretty much black, with creamy, bubbly brown head, which eventually is reduced to nice swirly lacing.  Interesting aroma - already this beer is out of the ordinary for imp. stouts.  Notes of roast and subtle smoke, tobacco, fruit tones like apple and candied dark fruit, raisin, fig, roasted and rich yet with a sweetness present.  Smooth, silky, creamy mouthfeel, with a slight milky aspect, full bodied but not as oily / thick as many imp. stouts.  Flavor is big on raisin and fig, with a roast chocolate aspect, and even apple / pear tones on the finish, which is long and ultimately ends on a subtly bitter roast.  Good although in retrospect this isnt really what I think of by imp. stout these days, its better characterized as a foreign stout.

Very dark and rich looking.  A short lived tan head becomes a ring.  An aroma that makes me salivate.  Thick malts, wood in the aroma.  Flavor begins with strong coffee, ashy wood, dark fruit, bitter citrus hops, lactose, dry chocolate.  Finish was sour and the hops came forward.  A very nice impy stout.
Pours black with dark brown small head. Sourly, florar, fruity and  madeira wine aroma. Acidy sweet and tart flavor. Full bodied on palate. Finish is sweet-tart and long lived.

330ml bottle. Pours thick dark black with a thin brown head. The aroma consists of caramel, roasty, chocolate, vanilla, woody, raisin, and a little earthy. The taste is a little sweet and somewhat bitter but with fairly dry finish.

Bottle from Friar Tuck in Savoy, IL. Pours a deep brown/black with a tan head that dissipates to a ring. Aroma of chocolate and dark roasted malts. Heavier side of medium bodied with average carbonation. Flavor of spent coffee grounds, black patent malts, and citrusy hops. Not much residual sweetness, but not over attuenated either. Semi dry and ashy finish, with some tannic or astringency notes as well. Not bad, and I like that this is not in a fucking bomber.

Bottle: Intensive roasty aroma, mainly roasted malt and coffee. Dark brown to black color, creamy, brownish head without good stability. Flavor is sweet, intensive malty with a lot of chocolate flavor, roasted malt,  licorice and bitter chocolate in the end. Dry, medium bitter and very roasty finish. Good stuff.

330 ml bottle @ home. Rated @ 19.11.2009.
Pours a clear dark red colour with a thick head. Roasted malt, coffee and licorice on the nose. Sweet taste with malts, chocolate and a bit of smokiness. Dry and hoppy finish. Medium bodied, oily texture and lively carbonation. This isnt an Imperial Stout at all. As it says on this page, "Foreign Stout" is about the right style for this.

11.2 oz bottle courtesy of Tim.  Pours a dark cola with a tiny light brown top that quickly fades.  Aroma of dark chocolate, bitter notes and roasted malt.  Taste of rich dark chocolate, baking chocolate, bitter notes and roasted malts.

A tasteful label, on this bottle that comes from a small Swedish brewery.  Sweet, mocha stout aroma with a little yeast.  The excellent flavor is full of rich, toasted grain.  There is also dark fruit, coffee, and a pleasant acidity.  Medium fizzy on the palate, and it fades to a gentle aftertaste.  A beautifully balanced and very drinkable medium-bodied stout.  Terrific - I look forward to my next bottle from Nils Oscar.
Aroma roasty malty, roasted malty taste,black, medium bitterness,  medium body,  oily feel,,nice dry roasty aftertaste.

330 ml. bottle. Pours a thin short lived head, over a dark brown (SRM 35) apparently clear body........nose is a combination of coffee, chocolate, toffee/caramel, bit of brown sugar......taste is coffee, chocolate, slight caramel, finishing with a hop, coffee bitterness.....mouth feel is medium, carbonation makes a lighter sensation. This is a lighter Imperial Stout (by the brewery), but I think the placement of it as a Foreign Stout is more accurate. It is a nice beer. BJCP 7/3/14/4/7

black body with light brown head..aroma of a baltic porter....lactose cream, brown sugar, vanilla, chocolate and marshmallow.  flavor is not as rich, and is slightly watery. still holds a nice nutty roasted appeal, but other elements seem to wade away in the background.  thinner palate than expected
UPDATED: JUN 3, 2011 Nice and smooth, not the most edgy of imperials, but I try to keep some around.
Bottle.  Dark brown pour, light tan head.  Dark roasted malts, chocolate, chocolate, and some nuts.  The beer is pretty soft and light, for being labeled "imperial stout".

Smokey, chocolate, & coffee, bringing dark Russian Rye/Pumpernickel to mind. Very smooth, yet a bit thin for the American palate. We so much go ver-the-top, but this would be considered a more subtle in palate. I definitely get a fair amount of bitterness, method by a faint wood taste down the center. I would mate this with some red meat, hamburger, etc. Tasted from the bottle @ 60°F from the bottle.

330 mL bottle for my 350th.  Pours black with a tan head.  Aroma is very strong dark fruit, molasses, something of a rich meaty aroma, cocoa, coffee, and cream.  Flavor is heavily roasted with strong dark chocolate and coffee flavors as well as a nice hoppy note, cream, and an earthy nuttiness.  Slick palate, a bit light compared to the rich flavors.  Overall very tasty and complex.
Transparent brown, no head. Roasted coffee, chocolate in aroma. Flavor much the same, really not much going on. Very thin for an impy st.
Poured a very dark brown with medium light brown head.  Aroma of expresso and chocolate.  Flavor is dominated by semi-sweet chocolate and coffee.  An outstanding Swedish stout.

Deep black liquid with a creamy mocha head that leaves excellent lacing.  Chocolate, gentle roasted malt. This is balanced right off the bat. Some mild sherry notes come through with a touch of fruitiness. A delicious, gentle, balanced stout. Its definitely milder than most Russian Imperial Stouts, but the flavors are there in spades. Its just the picture of chocolatey stout balance.  Smooth, creamy, very pleasant level of carbonation. Easy to drink, particularly for a RIS.

11.2oz bottle from VBM. Suprised I havent tried any of their beers yet. Pours a black opaque body with a medium light brown head with a lasting ring left throughout. Great aroma of milk chocolate, coffee, vanilla, licorice and other sweet, roasty notes. Flavor is bit more on the roasted bitter side but with a real nice sweet mocha prescense. Smooth, very easy drinking, medium bodied. Really good beer.
Bottle @ Alvinne proefzolder. Pours dark brown/blackish. Strong coffee and chocolate aroma. Good bitterness. Not wee heavy but rich in taste.
UPDATED: APR 18, 2012 Spectacular stout. Full bodied but very light dry finish for its alcohol content. Taste and nose of chocolate malts and bread. Rated 8/8/08
Dark black with roamy tan read head. Aroma is cola, malty and bready. Good complexity, coffee, grape, prune syrup. Could have used a bit more carbonation.

opaque black, thin brown head, very full body.

aroma: chocolate malt, silage, dried dark fruit, alcohol warmth.

taste:
